content:
Yes, there were several other musicians of Ray Charles' time who shared similar values and activism. Here are a few examples:

1. Nina Simone - Like Ray Charles, pianist and singer Nina Simone was a passionate advocate for civil rights and performed at numerous benefit concerts for organizations such as the NAACP and the Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee. She was also a vocal critic of racism and inequality, as evidenced by songs like "Mississippi Goddam" and "Young, Gifted, and Black."

2. Bob Dylan - Singer-songwriter Bob Dylan was heavily influenced by the Civil Rights Movement and wrote songs that addressed social and political issues of the time. His song "Blowin' in the Wind" became an anthem for the movement, and he performed at events such as the March on Washington.

3. Joan Baez - Folk singer Joan Baez was also a prominent supporter of the Civil Rights Movement, and frequently performed at rallies and protests. She was also involved in efforts to end the Vietnam War, and performed at the historic Woodstock festival in 1969.

These musicians, along with many others, used their talents and platforms to support and advance social justice causes.
